text:
in Domain.init(), if no namespace are defined in the Domain.xml file an error is
thrown and the class is not completely initialized (Domain.java line 437). as my
namespaces are dynamically defined, none are declared in the domain.xml - but i
still need to call the init method in order to define parameters and event
listeners. i do not really understand why an error should be thrown if no
namespace is defined, can it be removed ?
creator: thomas.draier@codeva.net

text:
Created attachment 12941
patch to remove the exception when no domain is defined
creator: thomas.draier@codeva.net

text:
I thought at least a clearly visible warning should be issued as in the normal
case this does not seem like a valid configuration. If you added I warning I
would apply the patch, though....
creator: ozeigermann@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 13130
added a warning when no domain is configured
creator: thomas.draier@codeva.net
